cz.cvut.felk.cig.jcop.problem.bucket
Class Bucket

java.lang.Object
  cz.cvut.felk.cig.jcop.problem.BaseProblem
      cz.cvut.felk.cig.jcop.problem.bucket.Bucket
All Implemented Interfaces:
DestinationProblem, Problem, StartingConfigurationProblem
public class Bucket
extends BaseProblem
implements Problem, DestinationProblem, StartingConfigurationProblem

Bucket problem.

Bucket problem is defined by having fixed number of buckets. Each of these buckets have their maximum capacity and starting capacity. Then each bucket could be fully filled or spilled empty. Furthermore each bucket's contents could be poured into another one using simple rule - if all contents from target fits to destination bucket, pour it all. If not, pour only what is possible and leave the remainder in source bucket.

TODO implement loaders from file or string

See Also:
Bucket problem on felk.cvut.fel, Fill operation, Spill operation, Pour operation

fillOperations

spillOperations

protected java.util.List<SpillOperation> spillOperations
Spill operations - one for each bucket. Index of list is equal to BucketItem.index

See Also:
SpillOperation

pourOperations

protected java.util.List<java.util.List<PourOperation>> pourOperations
Pour operations - each bucket has its own list (since one bucket could be poured to all other buckets. First index of list is equal to BucketItem.index. Second is equal to BucketItem.index of destination bucket iff destination bucket has BucketItem.index lower than source bucket. If it is higher, index in list is equal to destination's bucket BucketItem.index-1.

Constructor Detail

Bucket

public Bucket(int[] capacity,
              int[] startingContents,
              int[] destinationContents)
       throws ProblemFormatException
Creates new bucket problem from given capacity, starting contents and destination contents.

Note that this problem has Ο(n2) complexity just to create it (every bucket has n-1 operations to other buckets).

Parameters:
capacity - capacity for bucket 0 .. n-1
startingContents - starting contents for bucket 0 .. n-1
destinationContents - target contents for bucket 0 .. n-1
Throws:
ProblemFormatException - if three input arrays are not of same size or they are empty

getOperationIterator

public BucketIterator getOperationIterator(Configuration configuration)
Description copied from interface: Problem
Returns iterator for operations which are allowed for supplied attributes.

This iterator should be lazy initialized! If not, you are running into risk of performance problems (some algorithms creates lots of configurations and asks operationIterator for all of them).

Specified by:
getOperationIterator in interface Problem
Parameters:
configuration - attributes to return operationIterator for
Returns:
operatorIterator for this attributes

getDefaultFitness

public Fitness getDefaultFitness()
Description copied from interface: Problem
Returns default fitness for this problem.

Default fitness is object which is able to rank any attributes so that better attributes has higher rank.
